intro: Alsine canadensis var. angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairless stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dunes. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it an adaptable species in various ecological settings.
